title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Financial Compliance Examiners

content.rendered:
What is a Financial Compliance Examiner?

Financial Compliance Examiners review policies and regulations to find out their impacts.

Where does a Financial Compliance Examiner work?

  • Credit companies
  • Government
  • Investment companies

How much does a Financial Compliance Examiner make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for a Financial Compliance Examiner is $53,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Financial Compliance Examiners?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Finance majors
  • Economics majors
  • Accounting majors
Search Financial Compliance Examiner jobs

Financial Compliance Examiner skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Financial Compliance Examiners succeed in their work:

  • Attention to detail
  • Good math skills
  • Strong technical writing skills

What are some common questions about Financial Compliance Examiners?

Q: What are the two areas that Financial Examiners work in?

A: Consumer compliance and risk scoping.
